messages: a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:22): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: yes, but that's a UA requirement! :P
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:22): </sarcasm>

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:45): The main UA requirement would be for the UA to be AI-complete, so it can detect sarcasm and allow user stylesheets to highlight it in case the user wasn't reading carefully enough, which shouldn't be that hard

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:45): If browsers developers concentrated all their effort on the AI, then once they've finished they can sit back and the rest of the browser can literally write itself, after pointing it at a few C++ tutorials
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (00:46): <ai> does that
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (00:46): specifically, "data:text/html,<ai>"
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (00:48): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: are your slides available somewhere?
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (00:49): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: Then what happens when the browser discovers the HTML tutorials on the web? :)

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:56): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: I suppose you'd have to keep it in a carefully-controlled offline environment and only give it access to a limited number of documents, else it's likely to go insane like anyone else who looks at too much HTML
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (00:58): looks into putting his slides online
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (01:07): used the <u> element
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (01:09): Presentation is at http://www.w3.org/mid/op.ts7o3ua264w2qv edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e-t60.oslo.opera.com
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (01:09): cheers
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (01:09): (as in thanks, not as in bye :) )
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (01:10): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: btw, you don't need class="one-liner"
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (01:10): body > * { page-break-after:always; }
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (01:11): I think this is faster in browsers :p
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (01:11): yeah yeah :P
67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a (01:11): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e has made a very good presentation of html5 at the XTech lightning talk
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (01:18): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: lol at the plug :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (01:19): there were these Opera marketing people around :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (01:28): aded it to the list
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:50): comes back from meeting with the TAG
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:50): they didn't kill me!
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (01:50): did you get some soup?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:50): they are apparently reconsidering their versioning finding
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (01:51): is that http://www.w3.org/2001/tag/doc/versioning ?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:51): i mean the one in www-arch
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:51): but that document is part of the work they're doing yes
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (01:52): isn't following what TAG are doing
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:52): i wasn't either
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:52): i pointed out to them that what they were doing wasn't really useful to the html work
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:52): nor the css work
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:52): they didn't seem horrified by this
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:00): what is the finding saying? skimming that document didn't get me any wiser
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (02:02): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: so they didn't hassle you about content sniffing?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:02): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: that versioning information must be included

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:03): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: they asked me what they could do. i suggested rescinding the mime type finding. we then discussed why the finding was great theoretically, but couldn't work in many cases.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:04): i don't know if anything will happen
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (02:04): wow, the diagrams in that versioning finding hurt my brain
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:04): (i don't really see the point of the tag frankly)
